doc: The pathname to the file where to print the resulting chemical system.

Defines one or more SMARTS-based rules for identifying atoms to edit. Rules are separated by newline characters (i.e., each rule is defined in a single line). In each line, each space-separated string (i.e., a word) is interpreted as following: The first word is interpreted as a SMARTS string. Any following word is interpreted either as a keyword or a key-value pair. Keywords include 'REMOVE', which indicated that any atom matched by that rule should be removed. Key-value pairs include: 'ELEMENT: symbol', which allows to change the element of any atom matched by the SMARTS.

tag: the importing of chemical objects (e.g., molecular geometries)
